changeSet.author: Maeis Gharibjanian
changeSet.comment: Increasing the size of the password column. This should be enough to store most hashes generated from known hashing methods plus the generated salt.

changeSet.author: Khurram M Cheema
changeSet.comment: Adding a column to represent the encryption scheme. Here we are assuming that all clients are sticking to the default password hashing method which is MD5.

changeSet.author: Vladimir Carevski
changeSet.comment: It changes the hashed value of all test users to match the one from BCrypt

changeSet.author: Bilal Shah
changeSet.comment: Constant ID may need to be changed during merging of this feature to later branches to avoid overlapping with other preference IDs

column.name: content
column.value: Account Lockout Time

column.name: content
column.value: Number of minutes a User's account will remain locked after the number of allowed retries (Preference 39) are exhausted.

column.name: content
column.value: The number of retries to allow before locking the user account. A locked user account will be locked for the amount of minutes specified in Preference 68. To enable this locking feature, setting Preference 68 to a non-zero value is a must.

update.where: table_id = 50 and foreign_id = 39 and language_id = 1 and psudo_column = 'instruction'

column.name: content
column.value: A failed login attempt was made.

changeSet.author: Vikas Bodani
changeSet.sql: update base_user set change_password_date = now() where id = 1

changeSet.author: Morales Fernando G.

Asset reservation table
Adding indexes

changeSet.author: Vladimir Carevski
changeSet.comment: #10344 Implementing the asset assignment feature
changeSet.sql:
insert into asset_assignment (id, asset_id, order_line_id, start_datetime)
(select a.id, a.id, a.order_line_id, ooc.application_date from asset a inner join order_line ol on a.order_line_id = ol.id inner join order_change ooc on ooc.order_line_id = ol.id where a.order_line_id is not null and ooc.id = ( select oc.id from order_change oc inner join order_change_asset_map ocam on ocam.order_change_id = oc.id where oc.order_line_id = ol.id and ocam.asset_id = a.id order by oc.application_date desc limit 1));

changeSet.author: Vikas Bodani
changeSet.comment: Price subscription and expiration dates for customer price. Price expiration dates for Account Type price

changeSet.author: Aadil Nazir
changeSet.comment: #11369 Develop ability to identify inactive accounts
Added new column in base_user, value is set to date on which a user is marked in-active
Add new preference of Number of days after which a User's account will become inactive
Constant ID may need to be changed during merging of this feature to later branches to avoid overlapping with other preference IDs
foreign_id may need to be changed depending upon preference ID assigned above during merging to later branches

column.name: content
column.value: Expire Inactive Accounts After Days

changeSet.comment: foreign_id may need to be changed depending upon preference ID assigned above during merging to later branches

column.name: content
column.value: Number of days after which a User's account will become inactive. This will disable the ability to login to jBilling for that user.

changeSet.comment: Add new plug-in to make users inactive if they are not logged-in for number of days specified in the preference created above
Constant ID may need to be changed during merging of this feature to later branches to avoid overlapping with other plug-ins
foreign_id may need to be changed depending upon plug-in ID assigned above during merging to later branches

column.name: content
column.value: Inactive user account management plugin

changeSet.comment: foreign_id may need to be changed depending upon plug-in ID assigned above during merging to later branches

column.name: content
column.value: This is a scheduled plugin that takes in user that has not been logged-in for number of days specified in preference 55 and update there status to Inactive.

column.name: content
column.value: Should credentials be created by default

column.name: content
column.value: 1 to have credentials created by default when the user is created. 0 (default) to require credential creation be requested upon creation.

Define the notification message type. For new entities, this id will be used on EntityDefaults

This is the section message for the title

changeSet.comment: This is the section message for the content of the email

column.name: content
column.value:
Hello $first_name $last_name,

Welcome to JBilling!.

Please follow this link to set your credentials:

$newPasswordLink

column.name: content
column.value: User logged in successfully

column.name: content
column.value: User logged out successfully

column.name: content
column.value: User failed to log in due to incorrect username/password

column.name: content
column.value:
Hello $first_name $last_name,

You (or someone pretending to be you) requested a password reset of your account.

You may reset your password from the following link:

$newPasswordLink

Admin:	$organization_name

update.where:
content = 'Hello $first_name $last_name, You (or someone pretending to be you) requested a password reset of your account. If you access the following link your password will be changed to: $newPassword $newPasswordLink' or content = '

Hello $first_name $last_name,

You (or someone pretending to be you) requested a password reset of your account.

If you access the following link your password will be changed to: $newPassword

$newPasswordLink

'

changeSet.id: Removing Preferences for mediation, provisioning and ITG
changeSet.author: Manisha Gupta
Vikas Bodani
changeSet.comment: This table may exists because it may have gotten created from previous builds

column.name: content
column.value: Mediation Reader

column.name: content
column.value: Mediation Processor

column.name: content
column.value: Mediation Error Handler

column.name: content
column.value: This is a reader for the mediation process. It reads records from a text file whose fields are separated by a character (or string).

column.name: content
column.value: Rules mediation processor

column.name: content
column.value: This is a rules-based plug-in (see chapter 7). It takes an event record from the mediation process and executes external rules to translate the record into billing meaningful data. This is at the core of the mediation component, see the ?Telecom Guide? document for more information.

column.name: content
column.value: This is a reader for the mediation process. It reads records from a text file whose fields have fixed positions,and the record has a fixed length.

column.name: content
column.value: JDBC Mediation Reader.

column.name: content
column.value: This is a reader for the mediation process. It reads records from a JDBC database source.

column.name: content
column.value: MySQL Mediation Reader.

column.name: content
column.value: This is a reader for the mediation process. It is an extension of the JDBC reader, allowing easy configuration of a MySQL database source.

column.name: content
column.value: Mediation Process Task

column.name: content
column.value: A scheduled task to execute the Mediation Process.

column.name: content
column.value: Last read mediation record id.

column.name: content
column.value: Set to '1' to allow the usage of the 'main subscription' flag for orders This flag is read only by the mediation process when determining where to place charges coming from external events.

column.name: content
column.value: ID of the last record read by the mediation process. This is used to determine what records are 'new' and need to be read.

column.name: content
column.value: Show mediation menu
